cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northward tonight, then turning north-northeast on Thursday and paralleling the South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the central South Carolina coast (around the Charleston–Myrtle Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County FL line to Savannah River (T.S. Warning); Hurricane Warning north of Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast from northeast Florida through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are highly likely Wednesday night into early Thursday; brief gusts to hurricane force cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–7 ft possible in the Savannah River area, causing significant coastal flooding during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with pockets up to 6 inches; rapid runoff could produce flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and an isolated coastal tornado threat.
